options.name: Unblock
options.description:
> This API is only available for Enterprise and Cloud-unit plans. [Contact us for more information here.](https://www.browserless.io/contact/), or [sign-up here](https://www.browserless.io/pricing/).

Unblocks the provided URL from being blocked due to bot detection.
Returns a payload of Cookies, HTML, a base64 encoded screenshot,
and a "browserWSEndpoint" to allow connecting to the browser when
specified in the JSON Payload. Only supports CDP or Puppeteer
like libraries when connecting to the "browserWSEndpoint"

options.name: Pdf
options.description:
A JSON-based API for getting a PDF binary from either a supplied
"url" or "html" payload in your request. Many options exist for
injecting cookies, request interceptors, user-agents and waiting for
selectors, timers and more

options.name: Screenshot
options.description:
A JSON-based API for getting a screenshot binary from either a supplied
"url" or "html" payload in your request. Many options exist including
cookies, user-agents, setting timers and network mocks

options.name: Content
options.description: A JSON-based API. Given a "url" or "html" field, runs and returns HTML content after the page has loaded and JavaScript has parsed

options.name: Download
options.description:
A JSON or JavaScript content-type API for returning files Chrome has downloaded during
the execution of puppeteer code, which is ran inside context of the browser.
Browserless sets up a blank page, a fresh download directory, injects your puppeteer code, and then executes it.
You can load external libraries via the "import" syntax, and import ESM-style modules
that are written for execution inside of the browser. Once your script is finished, any
downloaded files from Chromium are returned back with the appropriate content-type header

options.name: Execute Function
options.description:
A JSON or JavaScript content-type API for running puppeteer code in the browser's context.
Browserless sets up a blank page, injects your puppeteer code, and runs it.
You can optionally load external libraries via the "import" module that are meant for browser usage.
Values returned from the function are checked and an appropriate content-type and response is sent back
to your HTTP call

options.name: Performance
options.description: Run lighthouse performance audits with a supplied "url" in your JSON payload

options.name: Scrape
options.description:
A JSON-based API that returns text, html, and meta-data from a given list of selectors.
Debugging information is available by sending in the appropriate flags in the "debugOpts"
property. Responds with an array of JSON objects

name: browserWSEndpoint
description:
Whether or not to keep the underlying browser alive and around for
future reconnects. Defaults to false

name: content
description: Whether or not to to return content for the site, defaults to true

name: screenshot
description: Whether or not to to return a full-page screenshot for the site, defaults to true

name: ttl
description:
When the browserWSEndpoint is requested this tells
browserless how long to keep this browser alive for
re-connection until shutting it down completely.
Maximum of 30000 for 30 seconds (30,000ms)

name: customBody
description: Custom body to send

name: url
description: The URL of the site you want to unblock

name: timeout
description:
Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds

name: enableCookies
description: Enable cookies

name: cookies
description: Array of cookie objects expected by cookie-editor extension

name: gotoOptions
description: An optional goto parameter object for considering when the page is done loading.

values.description:
If provided, it will take preference over the referer header value set by
{@link Page.setExtraHTTPHeaderspage.setExtraHTTPHeaders()}
values.name: referer

values.description:
If provided, it will take preference over the referer-policy header value
set by {@link Page.setExtraHTTPHeaderspage.setExtraHTTPHeaders()}
values.name: referrerPolicy

values.description:
Maximum wait time in milliseconds. Pass 0 to disable the timeout.

The default value can be changed by using the
{@link Page.setDefaultTimeout} or {@link Page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout}
methods
values.name: timeout

values.description:
When to consider waiting succeeds. Given an array of event strings, waiting
is considered to be successful after all events have been fired
values.name: waitUntil

values.description: A signal object that allows you to cancel the call
values.name: signal

name: blockAds
description:
Whether or nor to load ad-blocking extensions for the session.
This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly

values.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context
values.name: fn

values.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"
values.name: polling

values.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout
values.name: timeout

name: bestAttempt
description:
When bestAttempt is set to true, browserless attempt to proceed
when "awaited" events fail or timeout. This includes things like
goto, waitForSelector, and more

name: enableLaunch
description: Launch a new browser instance

name: customBody
description: Custom body to send

name: timeout
description:
Override the system-level timeout for this request.
Accepts a value in milliseconds

values.description: The page width in CSS pixels
values.name: width

values.description: The page height in CSS pixels
values.name: height

values.description:
Specify device scale factor.
See {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/devicePixelRatio devicePixelRatio} for more info
values.name: deviceScaleFactor

values.description: Whether the `meta viewport` tag is taken into account
values.name: isMobile

values.description: Specifies if the viewport is in landscape mode
values.name: isLandscape

values.description: Specify if the viewport supports touch events
values.name: hasTouch

name: setExtraHTTPHeaders
description: Set extra HTTP headers

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the header

values.name: value
values.description: Value of the header

name: enableCookies
description: Enable cookies

name: cookies
description: Array of cookie objects expected by cookie-editor extension

name: options
description: Valid options to configure PDF generation via {@link Page.pdf}

options.description: Scales the rendering of the web page. Amount must be between `0.1` and `2`
options.name: scale

options.description: Whether to show the header and footer
options.name: displayHeaderFooter

options.description:
HTML template for the print header. Should be valid HTML with the following
classes used to inject values into them:

- `date` formatted print date

- `title` document title

- `url` document location

- `pageNumber` current page number

- `totalPages` total pages in the document
options.name: headerTemplate

options.description:
HTML template for the print footer. Has the same constraints and support
for special classes as {@link PDFOptions.headerTemplate}
options.name: footerTemplate

options.description: Set to `true` to print background graphics
options.name: printBackground

options.description: Whether to print in landscape orientation
options.name: landscape

options.description: Paper ranges to print, e.g. `1-5, 8, 11-13`
options.name: pageRanges

options.description: All the valid paper format types when printing a PDF
options.name: format

options.description: Sets the width of paper. You can pass in a number or a string with a unit
options.name: width

options.description: Sets the height of paper. You can pass in a number or a string with a unit
options.name: height

options.description:
Give any CSS `@page` size declared in the page priority over what is
declared in the `width` or `height` or `format` option
options.name: preferCSSPageSize

options.description: Set the PDF margins
options.name: margin

options.description: The path to save the file to
options.name: path

options.description: Hides default white background and allows generating pdfs with transparency
options.name: omitBackground

options.description: Generate tagged (accessible) PDF
options.name: tagged

options.description: Generate document outline
options.name: outline

options.description:
Timeout in milliseconds. Pass `0` to disable timeout.

The default value can be changed by using {@link Page.setDefaultTimeout}
options.name: timeout

options.description:
If true, waits for `document.fonts.ready` to resolve. This might require
activating the page using {@link Page.bringToFront} if the page is in the
background
options.name: waitForFonts

values.description:
If provided, it will take preference over the referer header value set by
{@link Page.setExtraHTTPHeaderspage.setExtraHTTPHeaders()}
values.name: referer

values.description:
If provided, it will take preference over the referer-policy header value
set by {@link Page.setExtraHTTPHeaderspage.setExtraHTTPHeaders()}
values.name: referrerPolicy

values.description:
Maximum wait time in milliseconds. Pass 0 to disable the timeout.

description:

This currently uses uBlock Origin and may cause certain sites
to not load properly

values.description:
An array of patterns (using `req.url().match(r.pattern)` to match) and their
corresponding responses to use in order to fulfill those requests
values.name: pattern

values.description: Optional response headers. All values are converted to strings
values.name: headers

values.description: The function, or statement, to be evaluated in browser context
values.name: fn

values.description:
An interval at which the pageFunction is executed, defaults to raf.
If polling is a number, then it is treated as an interval in milliseconds
at which the function would be executed. If polling is a string,
then it can be one of the following values: "raf" or "mutation"
values.name: polling

values.description:
Maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).
Pass 0 to disable timeout
values.name: timeout

values.description: URL of the script to be added
values.name: url

values.description: Path to a JavaScript file to be injected into the frame
values.name: path

values.description: JavaScript to be injected into the frame
values.name: content

values.description: Sets the `type` of the script. Use `module` in order to load an ES2015 module
values.name: type

values.description: Sets the `id` of the script
values.name: id

values.description: the URL of the CSS file to be added
values.name: url

values.description: The path to a CSS file to be injected into the frame
values.name: path

values.description: Raw CSS content to be injected into the frame
values.name: content

options.description: Quality of the image, between 0-100. Not applicable to `png` images

options.description: Capture the screenshot from the surface, rather than the view

options.description: When `true`, takes a screenshot of the full page

options.description: Hides default white background and allows capturing screenshots with transparency
options.name: omitBackground

options.description:
The file path to save the image to. The screenshot type will be inferred
from file extension. If path is a relative path, then it is resolved
relative to current working directory. If no path is provided, the image
won't be saved to the disk
options.name: path

options.description: Specifies the region of the page/element to clip

values.name: width

values.description: the height of the element in pixels

options.name: clip

options.description: Encoding of the image
